title: Session 1: Introduction and Review
description: Review of Level-1 concepts, Level-1 exam, introduction to opening, middlegame, and endgame, counting the points.

title: Session 2: Basic Game Concepts
description: Check, checkmate, and stalemate identification; CBM rule (Check, Block, Move).

title: Session 3: Advanced Check and Double Check
description: Double check concepts, practical examples and exercises.

title: Session 4: Mate in One and Opening Theory
description: Mate in one problems, general opening theory, importance of center squares, famous chess players.

title: Session 5: Exchanges and Threats
description: Profitable exchanges, attacker, defender, and threat identification; ways to defend against threats.

title: Session 6: Enprise and Tactical Awareness
description: Understanding enprise (undefended pieces), tactical awareness exercises.

title: Session 7: Advanced Piece Management
description: Taking more important pieces, more/better attackers than defenders scenarios.

title: Session 8: Trapping Pieces
description: Trapping and the importance of finding trapped pieces, exercises on finding trapped pieces.

title: Session 9: Forks
description: Introduction to forks, recognizing and setting up forks, exercises on forks.

title: Session 10: Pins
description: Understanding pins, types of pins (absolute and relative), exercises on pins.

title: Session 11: Skewers
description: Introduction to skewers, recognizing and setting up skewers, exercises on skewers.

title: Session 12: Endgame Basics
description: King and Queen mate, King and Pawn endings (till promotion), Square rule.

title: Session 13: Advanced Endgame Techniques
description: King and Rook mate, King and Double Bishop mate.

title: Session 14: Checkmate Patterns I
description: Common checkmate patterns (e.g., Back-rank mate, Anastasia's mate), exercises on recognizing checkmate patterns.

title: Session 15: Checkmate Patterns II
description: Common checkmate patterns (e.g., Back-rank mate, Anastasia's mate), exercises on recognizing checkmate patterns.

title: Session 16: Basic Openings
description: Overview of basic openings (e.g., Ruy Lopez, Sicilian Defense), opening principles.

title: Session 17: Middlegame Strategies
description: Middlegame planning, positional play vs. tactical play.

title: Session 18: Advanced Middlegame Concepts
description: Pawn structure, piece coordination.

title: Session 19: Game Analysis
description: Analyzing master games, identifying critical moments in the game.

title: Session 20: Level-2 Exam
description: Comprehensive review of all topics covered, final exam, feedback, and course completion.
